name: Goblin Ambush
roomDescription: The corridor opens into a cramped chamber littered with broken crates and moldy sacks. Crude torches flicker in rusted sconces, casting dancing shadows across the walls. A chorus of high-pitched cackles erupts from behind an overturned wagon as small green figures scramble for weapons.
dmDescription: Five goblins have claimed this storage room as their lair. Two warriors hide behind the wagon (half cover) while three minions lurk on a 10ft ledge to the left (can be spotted with DC 12 Perception). The goblins will flee if reduced to 2 or fewer. A DC 13 Intimidation check after killing the warriors causes immediate surrender. Hidden under a loose stone (DC 14 Investigation): 15 gp and a Potion of Healing.

winConditions.reward: 75% XP, goblins reveal nearby trap location
No XP, but avoid resource expenditure

aiRoomPrompt: A 120ft x 100ft underground dungeon storage room with 5ft grid. Stone walls and floor with scattered debris. An overturned wooden wagon provides cover in the center. A 10ft high ledge runs along the left wall with a crude ladder. Dim torchlight. Several broken crates and moldy supply sacks throughout. One entrance at the south, one exit at the north.

name: Undead Crypt
roomDescription: Ancient stone sarcophagi line the walls of this burial chamber, their lids askew or shattered completely. The air is thick with the stench of decay and dust. As you step inside, bony fingers scrape against stone and rotting corpses lurch upright, empty eye sockets fixing upon you with unnatural hunger.
dmDescription: Three skeletons rise from alcoves along the walls while two zombies shamble from behind the central sarcophagus. The undead are animated by a cursed gemstone hidden inside the large sarcophagus (DC 15 Investigation to find, DC 13 Religion to identify its nature). Destroying the gem (AC 13, 10 HP, vulnerable to radiant) causes all undead to collapse. A cleric's Turn Undead is especially effective here. The central sarcophagus contains: 25 gp, a silver holy symbol (15 gp), and a Scroll of Cure Wounds.

winConditions.reward: Full XP + 50 bonus XP for clever solution

aiRoomPrompt: A 150ft x 120ft ancient stone crypt with 5ft grid. Stone sarcophagi line both long walls (6 total). A large ornate sarcophagus sits on a raised platform in the center. Dim green magical light emanates from cracks in the floor. Cobwebs in corners, scattered bones, and broken funeral urns. Two entrances on opposite ends.

name: Rat Warren
roomDescription: A foul stench assaults your nostrils as you enter this low-ceilinged chamber. The floor is carpeted with refuse and gnawed bones. Red eyes gleam from dozens of holes in the crumbling walls, and the sound of chittering fills the air. Massive rats the size of dogs emerge from the shadows, their yellowed teeth bared.
dmDescription: The giant rats attack immediately, drawn by hunger. The swarm emerges from a large hole in the floor on round 2 unless players seal it first (can block with debris, DC 12 Athletics). The rats are protecting a nest in the southeast corner containing stolen goods: a merchant's lockbox (DC 15 Thieves' Tools to open) with 35 gp and a gemstone worth 50 gp. Fire and area effects work well here. Disease risk: any player bitten must make DC 10 Constitution save or contract Sewer Plague.

winConditions.condition: Use fire to drive them off
Block the nest hole and flee
winConditions.reward: No XP, but can return later prepared

aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 100ft low-ceilinged sewer junction with 5ft grid. Refuse and debris piles scattered throughout. Multiple rat holes (2ft diameter) in the walls and one large hole (5ft) in the floor near center. Shallow water (difficult terrain) in the lower third of the room. Dim light from phosphorescent fungus. Three tunnel exits.

name: Kobold Trappers
roomDescription: This natural cavern glitters with mineral deposits that catch your torchlight. Crude rope bridges span a 20-foot wide crevasse that splits the chamber. On the far side, small reptilian creatures chitter excitedly, their scales glinting orange and brown. Two of them have small leathery wings and hover near the ceiling, clutching rocks.
dmDescription: The kobolds have prepared this ambush carefully. The rope bridges are trapped—cutting a rope (DC 12 to notice, AC 10, 5 HP) drops anyone on it into the 30ft crevasse (3d6 fall damage). Winged kobolds drop rocks from above (ranged attack, 1d6 damage) and stay out of melee range. The ground kobolds use Pack Tactics. DC 15 Persuasion with Draconic language: kobolds reveal they serve a 'great dragon' (actually just a pseudodragon they worship). Hidden cache behind a loose rock (DC 14 Investigation): 20 gp, 3 javelins, and a vial of alchemist's fire.

winConditions.reward: No XP, but costs 10 gp tribute

winConditions.condition: Discover and offer tribute to their 'dragon'

aiRoomPrompt: A 180ft x 150ft natural cavern with 5ft grid. A 20ft wide, 30ft deep crevasse runs through the middle. Two rope bridges cross the crevasse (5ft wide each). The far side is 10ft higher than the entrance. Glittering mineral deposits on walls. Stalactites hang from 40ft ceiling. Natural stone formations provide cover on both sides. One entrance, main exit on the elevated far side.

name: Cultist Ritual
roomDescription: Crimson candles illuminate a profane altar at the center of this circular chamber. Robed figures chant in an unknown language, their voices rising and falling in unsettling harmony. Four skeletal warriors stand motionless at the cardinal points, empty eyes gleaming with unholy light. The lead cultist raises a bloodied dagger as you enter, screaming 'Intruders! The ritual must not be stopped!'
dmDescription: The cultists are attempting to summon a shadow demon (will arrive in 5 rounds if not stopped). Disrupting the ritual: destroy the altar (AC 15, 25 HP), kill the lead cultist (robed in red, has 15 HP instead of normal), or scatter the ritual components (DC 14 Arcana or Sleight of Hand). The skeletons obey the lead cultist—if he dies, they become uncontrolled and attack the nearest creature. Two cultists will try to flee and warn others if the ritual fails. Treasure on altar: silver ritual dagger (25 gp), unholy symbol (can be sold to right buyer for 30 gp), and a Potion of Healing.

winConditions.condition: Kill lead cultist only and flee
winConditions.reward: 100 XP, ritual fails, but survivors escape

aiRoomPrompt: A 150ft diameter circular ritual chamber with 5ft grid. A stone altar with glowing runes sits in the exact center on a raised platform (5ft high). Four pillars mark the cardinal directions (skeleton positions). Crimson candles arranged in arcane patterns. Dark tapestries depicting demonic entities on walls. Shadowy alcoves between pillars. Single grand entrance with heavy stone doors. Ominous red glow from the altar.

name: Spider Nest
roomDescription: Thick webs coat the walls and ceiling of this chamber, forming gossamer curtains that sway in an unfelt breeze. Desiccated husks hang in cocoons throughout the space—some disturbingly humanoid in shape. A chittering sound echoes from all directions as multiple pairs of gleaming eyes emerge from the webbing, and segmented legs unfold from the shadows.
dmDescription: The spiders attack from ambush, dropping from ceiling webs (DC 13 Perception to notice before combat, surprised if failed). Webs throughout room count as difficult terrain and can restrain characters who enter (DC 11 Dexterity save or restrained, DC 12 Strength to escape). Fire destroys webs instantly but alerts all creatures. One cocoon contains a still-living adventurer (unconscious but stable at 0 HP)—rescuing them grants a contact and potential reward later. Treasure in a webbed corner: the adventurer's pack containing 40 gp, a healer's kit (half used), and a silvered dagger.

winConditions.reward: 50% XP, nest destroyed but creatures may survive

aiRoomPrompt: A 140ft x 120ft natural cavern with 5ft grid. Dense spider webs covering 60% of floor (difficult terrain), all walls, and ceiling. Multiple cocoons hanging from ceiling and attached to walls (some humanoid-sized). Narrow clear paths wind between web masses. Dim bioluminescent fungi on unweb bed sections of floor. Two exits on opposite corners, one partially blocked by webs.

name: Stirge Feeding Ground
roomDescription: The buzzing grows louder as you enter this domed chamber. Something wet drips from above—looking up reveals a nightmare. Dozens of bat-like creatures with long proboscises cling to the ceiling, their bloated bodies pulsing with recently consumed blood. Several of the smaller ones detach and dive toward you, their needle-like appendages extended.
dmDescription: Eight stirges occupy this chamber, drawn by the warmth of adventurers. Only 4 attack initially; the remaining 4 are bloated and will only join combat if their territory is threatened (round 3 or if fire/loud noises used). Stirges that successfully attach deal automatic damage each round and must be killed or pulled off (DC 12 Strength). The bloated stirges are slower (20ft fly speed) but have already dealt their blood drain. Escape is easy—stirges won't pursue beyond this room. Dried blood pools mark previous victims; DC 13 Investigation reveals a skeleton with: 12 gp, a rusty shortsword, and a silver ring (10 gp).

winConditions.condition: Use fire/smoke to drive them away

aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft diameter domed chamber with 5ft grid. 30ft high domed ceiling covered with handholds and small ledges. Dried blood pools and old bones scattered on floor. Dim light from cracks in the dome. Rough uneven floor with some rubble piles. Two low tunnel entrances on opposite sides. Gore-stained central floor area.

name: Bandit Checkpoint
roomDescription: The tunnel widens into a fortified checkpoint. A crude barricade of overturned carts and barrels blocks the path forward, with armed men positioned behind it. Two large dogs strain at their chains, growling at your approach. A scarred woman steps forward, crossbow aimed at your chest. 'Toll's fifty gold per head. Can't pay? You can leave your gear and crawl back the way you came.'
dmDescription: These bandits have claimed this chokepoint and extort travelers. The leader (female bandit with 15 HP, has a Potion of Healing) will negotiate—DC 15 Intimidation causes them to demand only 25 gp total, DC 18 makes them let the party pass free. The two guards are former soldiers and better equipped (chain shirt, AC 16). The mastiffs are released if combat starts. A hidden passage (DC 16 Perception) behind a false wall allows flanking. Treasure behind the barricade: lockbox with 80 gp, a crossbow with 20 bolts, and stolen goods worth 50 gp (could be returned for reward in town).
aiRoomPrompt: A 130ft x 80ft underground corridor checkpoint with 5ft grid. A barricade of overturned carts and barrels (half cover, 20ft wide) blocks the center. Watchtower-like raised platform (10ft high) behind barricade for crossbow users. Two chain posts for dogs in front of barricade. Crates and supply stacks on both sides. Torches provide normal lighting. Main entrance at south, exit at north blocked by barricade. Hidden passage behind false wall on east side.

name: Crawling Horror
roomDescription: Severed hands skitter across the floor like grotesque spiders, their fingers tapping against stone in an unsettling rhythm. Two shambling corpses stand motionless in the shadows, only lurching forward when you draw near.
dmDescription: The crawling claws swarm the nearest target while zombies lumber toward whoever deals the most damage. Claws can be kicked away (shove action). Holy water affects all undead in a 5ft radius.

winConditions.condition: Use holy water or Turn Undead

aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 80ft stone morgue with 5ft grid. Stone slabs with bodies line the walls. Dim candlelight. Scattered bones on floor.

name: Wolf Pack
roomDescription: Low growls echo through this cavern. Yellow eyes gleam from the darkness as a pack of gaunt wolves emerges, circling your party with practiced coordination.
dmDescription: Wolves use Pack Tactics for advantage. They target isolated characters and flee if reduced to 2 or fewer. DC 15 Animal Handling calms the alpha, stopping the attack.
aiRoomPrompt: A 120ft x 100ft natural cave with 5ft grid. Rocky outcroppings provide cover. Bones and animal remains scattered about. Two exits.

name: Myconid Grove
roomDescription: Phosphorescent fungi illuminate this damp cavern in shades of purple and blue. Mushrooms of unusual size cluster together, some swaying despite the still air. As you approach, smaller fungi scatter while larger ones extend writhing tendrils.
dmDescription: The myconids release spores if threatened (DC 11 Con save or poisoned 1 min). Violet fungi are stationary but deadly. Fire is very effective here.
aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 100ft mushroom cavern with 5ft grid. Giant glowing fungi throughout. Damp floor with puddles. Phosphorescent lighting.

name: Grimlock Patrol
roomDescription: Eyeless humanoids with gray, rubbery skin sniff the air and cock their heads, listening. Their stone axes scrape against the floor as they advance with unnerving accuracy despite their blindness.
dmDescription: Grimlocks use blindsight 30ft. Light is useless against them. They communicate via clicks and rely on sound. Silence spell renders them blind. They carry 10 gp each.

winConditions.condition: Use Silence to disable their senses

aiRoomPrompt: A 110ft x 90ft dark underground tunnel junction with 5ft grid. No light sources. Rough stone walls. Three tunnel exits.

name: Troglodyte Lair
roomDescription: An overwhelming stench hits you before you even see them. Reptilian creatures with mottled gray-green scales hiss and brandish crude weapons, their putrid odor making your eyes water.
dmDescription: Troglodyte Stench: DC 12 Con save or poisoned until start of next turn. They fight to the death defending their nest. Eggs in the corner could be destroyed or sold (50 gp to the right buyer).
aiRoomPrompt: A 130ft x 100ft fetid cave with 5ft grid. Nest materials and bones in corners. Shallow stagnant pools. Terrible odor indication marks.

name: Bat Swarm Cave
roomDescription: The ceiling writhes with fur and leathery wings. Thousands of bats hang overhead, disturbed by your torchlight. With a deafening screech, they explode into chaotic flight.
dmDescription: Bats attack if startled (loud noise, bright light, approaching within 15ft). Extinguishing lights and moving slowly (DC 12 Stealth) avoids combat. Fire panics them more. Guano on floor is valuable fertilizer (10 gp worth).
aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 80ft cave with 5ft grid. High 40ft ceiling covered with bats. Guano-covered floor (difficult terrain). Two exits.

name: Darkmantle Ambush
roomDescription: Stalactites hang from the ceiling of this cavern like stone teeth. As you pass beneath them, two 'rocks' unfurl leathery wings and drop toward you, engulfing the area in magical darkness.
dmDescription: Darkmantles create 15ft radius darkness. They grapple heads and blind targets. DC 13 Perception spots them before attack. Light spells counter their darkness. Prior victims' gear lies below: 25 gp, a dagger, rope.

winConditions.condition: Use Light to reveal and avoid

aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 100ft stalactite cavern with 5ft grid. Many stalactites on 30ft ceiling. Rocky floor with debris. Dim natural light from cracks.

name: Cockatrice Nest
roomDescription: Bizarre creatures with the body of a rooster and the tail of a serpent strut around this chamber. Several stone statues of adventurers stand frozen in poses of terror. The cockatrices screech and charge.
dmDescription: Petrification: DC 11 Con save or restrained, then petrified on failed repeat save. Greater Restoration or waiting 24 hours cures petrification. The 'statues' have gear worth 75 gp total. Eggs worth 100 gp each (3 in nest).
aiRoomPrompt: A 140ft x 120ft cave with 5ft grid. Stone 'statues' of adventurers scattered about. Nest with eggs in corner. Feathers and debris everywhere.

name: Shadow Haunt
roomDescription: The darkness here feels alive. Your torchlight seems to shrink, swallowed by an unnatural blackness. Shapes move at the edge of your vision—humanoid silhouettes that glide silently closer.
dmDescription: Shadows drain Strength (1d4 on hit). If Str reaches 0, target dies and rises as shadow. They hide in dim light and attack with advantage from darkness. Radiant damage is very effective. A desecrated altar powers them—destroying it (DC 13 Religion to identify, AC 12, 20 HP) banishes them.
aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 100ft dark shrine with 5ft grid. Desecrated altar in center. Broken holy symbols. Unnaturally dark corners. Dim flickering torchlight.

name: Rust Monster Tunnel
roomDescription: Insect-like creatures with long antennae scuttle toward you, their feelers twitching eagerly at your weapons and armor. Corroded equipment and rust-flaked bones litter the floor.
dmDescription: Rust monsters destroy nonmagical metal on contact. Smart parties remove metal armor first. They're not evil, just hungry—throwing metal objects distracts them (1 round per item). Wooden and leather gear is immune. Treasure: rusted coins (worth 15 gp if cleaned).

winConditions.condition: Distract with metal scraps and flee

aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 80ft mine tunnel with 5ft grid. Rusted mining equipment. Corroded metal debris. Orange-stained walls. Two exits.

name: Orc Scouts
roomDescription: Muscular gray-skinned warriors crouch around a small fire, their brutal weapons close at hand. They spot you and rise with eager grins, clearly pleased at the prospect of violence.
dmDescription: Orcs use Aggressive to close distance quickly. They fight recklessly but flee if leader falls. Their camp has supplies: rations for 10 days, 40 gp, a crude map showing nearby orc stronghold.
aiRoomPrompt: A 120ft x 100ft underground camp with 5ft grid. Small campfire in center. Bedrolls and supplies. Crude bone decorations. One main entrance, one escape tunnel.

name: Hobgoblin Sentries
roomDescription: Three armored goblinoids stand at rigid attention, their military bearing evident. They wear matching insignia and respond to your presence with coordinated precision, leveling crossbows in unison.
dmDescription: Hobgoblins use Martial Advantage (+2d6 damage if ally adjacent). They fight tactically: one engages in melee while two provide crossbow support. If losing, they attempt organized retreat to warn others. Treasure: 20 gp each, military orders written in Goblin.

winConditions.reward: Full XP + intelligence on hobgoblin forces

aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 80ft stone guardpost with 5ft grid. Firing positions behind low walls. Weapon racks. Military banners. Two entrances.

name: Magma Mephit Vent
roomDescription: Heat radiates from cracks in the floor where molten rock glows orange. Small humanoid figures made of living magma cackle as they rise from the vents, hurling globs of fire.
dmDescription: Mephits have Death Burst: explode for 2d6 fire in 5ft when killed. They fly and use ranged fire attacks. Water deals 1d6 cold damage to them. Obsidian chunks worth 25 gp can be harvested.
aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 100ft volcanic cave with 5ft grid. Lava vents and cracks. Orange glow lighting. Obsidian formations. Heat shimmer effect.

name: Ice Mephit Cavern
roomDescription: Your breath mists in the sudden cold. Icicles hang from every surface, and frost creeps across the walls. Two small creatures of animate ice swoop down, cackling with malice as they exhale blasts of freezing air.
dmDescription: Ice mephits use Frost Breath: 10ft cone, DC 10 Dex, 2d4 cold. Death Burst: 5ft radius ice shards. Fire damage is very effective. Frozen corpse of previous adventurer has: 30 gp, a Potion of Healing, frozen solid (1 hour to thaw).
aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 80ft frozen cavern with 5ft grid. Ice-covered surfaces. Icicles hanging from ceiling. Frozen pool in center. Blue-white lighting.

name: Gray Ooze Pool
roomDescription: The floor here looks strangely wet, reflecting your torchlight in oily ripples. As you step closer, sections of the 'floor' rise up—living puddles of translucent gray slime that flow toward you.
dmDescription: Gray oozes dissolve metal armor and weapons (nonmagical). DC 12 Perception to notice before stepping on one. They're slow (10ft) but persistent. Fire and cold work normally. Remains contain partially dissolved coins: 20 gp worth.
aiRoomPrompt: A 80ft x 80ft wet stone chamber with 5ft grid. Puddles and damp floor. Reflective surfaces. Corroded metal debris. Two exits.

name: Worg Riders
roomDescription: The thunder of paws echoes through the corridor. Massive wolves the size of horses charge toward you, goblin riders on their backs whooping with savage glee as they level their spears.
dmDescription: Worgs understand Goblin and can communicate. Killing a worg throws its rider (DC 10 Dex or prone). Goblins dismount if worg dies. Worgs flee if both riders die. Treasure: 30 gp, crude jewelry worth 15 gp.
aiRoomPrompt: A 150ft x 100ft wide tunnel with 5ft grid. Open space for mounted combat. Columns for cover. Two wide exits.

name: Piercer Cave
roomDescription: Sharp stalactites crowd the ceiling of this cave, some seeming to drip with moisture. As you walk beneath them, several detach and plummet toward you like living spears.
dmDescription: Piercers drop for 3d6 piercing (DC 12 Dex halves). They get one attack then are helpless on the ground (AC 11, 22 HP). DC 15 Perception spots them as fake stalactites. Moving along walls avoids them. Treasure under debris: 35 gp, a gemstone (50 gp).
aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 100ft stalactite cave with 5ft grid. Dense stalactites on 40ft ceiling. Rocky floor with debris. Narrow paths between formations.

name: Giant Insect Hive
roomDescription: A papery structure clings to the cavern walls, buzzing with activity. Giant wasps patrol while armored centipedes writhe along the floor. The insects turn toward you with predatory intent.
dmDescription: Wasps dive-bomb casters while centipedes swarm melee fighters. Centipede poison: DC 11 Con or 10 poison damage + poisoned. Fire destroys the hive but enrages survivors. Honey in hive is valuable: 30 gp worth.
aiRoomPrompt: A 140ft x 100ft cavern with 5ft grid. Large papery wasp nest on one wall. Tunnel holes for centipedes. Organic debris on floor.

name: Gnoll Foragers
roomDescription: Hyena-like humanoids crouch over fresh kills, their muzzles stained with blood. They look up with hungry eyes, abandoning their meal for fresher prey—you.
dmDescription: Gnolls have Rampage: bonus action bite after dropping a creature to 0 HP. They're always hungry and never negotiate. Their camp has disturbing remains and 45 gp in loot from victims.
aiRoomPrompt: A 110ft x 90ft bloody feeding area with 5ft grid. Remains and bones scattered about. Crude camp. Torchlight. Two exits.

name: Twig Blight Ambush
roomDescription: Dead vegetation chokes this abandoned underground garden. Skeletal bushes and withered vines fill the space. As you pass, the 'dead' plants twitch and rise, revealing themselves as shambling plant creatures.
dmDescription: Twig blights are weak but numerous. They're vulnerable to fire (double damage). They serve a Gulthias Tree somewhere nearby (plot hook). DC 14 Nature reveals their origin. Druidic focus buried here: 25 gp value.

winConditions.condition: Use fire to quickly eliminate them

aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 80ft underground garden with 5ft grid. Dead vegetation throughout. Broken planters and rotten trellises. Dim light from luminescent moss.

name: Needle Blight Thicket
roomDescription: Pine-like plant creatures stand motionless among dead trees. Their needle-covered bodies bristle as you approach, and they raise arm-like branches to unleash volleys of razor-sharp needles.
dmDescription: Needle blights attack at range (30ft, 2d4 piercing). They're slow in melee. Vulnerable to fire. Cover is essential against their needle volleys. Resin from dead blights is alchemically useful: 15 gp worth.
aiRoomPrompt: A 120ft x 100ft dead forest chamber with 5ft grid. Dead trees and brush. Needle-covered floor. Limited cover. Natural lighting from above.

name: Vine Blight Grove
roomDescription: Thick vines cover every surface of this underground chamber. As you move through, the vines stir and coil. Two masses of vegetation rise up, their tendrils reaching to entangle you.
dmDescription: Vine blights can grapple and restrain (DC 12 Str to escape). They use Entangling Plants: 15ft radius difficult terrain. Fire is very effective. DC 15 Nature to identify before they attack. Rare herbs grow here: 40 gp worth.

winConditions.condition: Use fire to burn through quickly
winConditions.reward: Full XP + destroy vines for future parties

aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 100ft vine-covered chamber with 5ft grid. Dense vegetation everywhere. Vine curtains block visibility. Damp and humid.

name: Kenku Thieves
roomDescription: Ravenlike humanoids scatter as you enter, clutching stolen goods. They mimic the sound of your own voices, creating confusing echoes as they prepare to defend their hoard.
dmDescription: Kenku use Mimicry to create distractions (DC 14 Insight to recognize). They prefer to flee with their loot rather than fight to the death. Stolen goods here: 60 gp, a silver necklace (25 gp), various trinkets.
aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 90ft cluttered hideout with 5ft grid. Piles of stolen goods. Makeshift perches on walls. Multiple shadowy corners. Two exits.

name: Animated Armor Guardian
roomDescription: Two suits of plate armor stand sentinel flanking an ornate doorway. As you approach, they animate with grinding metallic sounds, drawing swords and advancing with mechanical precision.
dmDescription: Animated armor has Antimagic Susceptibility and is immune to many conditions. They guard the door and won't pursue beyond the room. Speaking the command word 'Korvan' (DC 18 Investigation to find hidden on door frame) deactivates them.

winConditions.condition: Find and speak the command word

aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 80ft grand hall with 5ft grid. Ornate doorway at far end. Two armor display alcoves flanking it. Tapestries on walls. Polished stone floor.

name: Swarm Infestation
roomDescription: The walls seem to move. Thousands of insects crawl across every surface, their chitinous bodies rustling. Rats scurry among them, all turning toward you as one seething mass.
dmDescription: Swarms are resistant to physical damage but vulnerable to fire and area effects. They fill spaces and deal automatic damage. Sealing exits and using fire forces them away. Roach eggs in wall cracks could be valuable to alchemists: 15 gp.

winConditions.condition: Use fire to clear the room

aiRoomPrompt: A 90ft x 90ft infested room with 5ft grid. Walls covered with insects (visual effect). Debris and refuse piles. Dim lighting. Multiple small exits.

name: Kuo-toa Shrine
roomDescription: Fish-like humanoids prostrate before a grotesque idol made of debris and bones. Their bulging eyes fixate on you, and they shriek in an alien tongue, grabbing spears and nets.
dmDescription: Kuo-toa have Slippery trait (advantage vs grapple) and use nets. Their 'god' idol is worthless but they believe in it utterly. DC 15 Deception to pose as servants of their god grants safe passage. The idol has offerings: 30 gp in shells and coins.
aiRoomPrompt: A 110ft x 100ft flooded shrine with 5ft grid. Shallow water (difficult terrain) throughout. Crude idol on raised platform. Torches in wet sconces.

name: Flying Sword Gallery
roomDescription: Swords hang on racks along the walls of this old armory. As you enter, four blades rise from their holders, hovering in the air before darting toward you with deadly speed.
dmDescription: Flying swords are fragile (HP 17) but fast and hit hard. They have Antimagic Susceptibility. Dispel Magic deactivates them. The armory contains mundane weapons worth 50 gp total. A masterwork longsword (75 gp) is hidden in a locked case.
aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 70ft armory with 5ft grid. Weapon racks on all walls. Display cases. Stone floor. Single entrance with heavy doors.

name: Giant Spider Lair
roomDescription: Webs fill every corner of this massive cavern. Spiders of various sizes skitter across the silken strands, and eight large specimens drop from above, their fangs dripping venom.
dmDescription: Spiders attack from webs (advantage if target in web). Spider Climb lets them attack from any angle. Poison: DC 11 Con or 2d6 poison + poisoned. Fire destroys webs quickly. Cocooned corpse has: 45 gp, a silver ring (20 gp), and a Potion of Healing.
aiRoomPrompt: A 160ft x 140ft web-filled cavern with 5ft grid. Dense webs (difficult terrain) everywhere. Cocooned shapes. High ceiling with web strands.

name: Zombie Horde
roomDescription: The stench of decay is overwhelming. Corpses in various states of rot shamble toward you, their dead eyes empty, their jaws snapping hungrily. There are so many of them.
dmDescription: Zombies have Undead Fortitude (DC 5+damage Con save to stay at 1 HP instead of dropping). Radiant damage bypasses this. They're slow but numerous. Bottleneck doorways to fight fewer at once. Silver holy symbol among corpses: 25 gp.

winConditions.condition: Use radiant damage to ensure kills

aiRoomPrompt: A 150ft x 120ft crypt with 5ft grid. Broken coffins and open graves. Narrow doorways for chokepoints. Dim green glow.

name: Skeleton Archers
roomDescription: Bony archers stand on elevated platforms around this circular room, their empty eye sockets fixed on you. Arrows nock simultaneously as they draw back in eerie unison.
dmDescription: Skeletons on 10ft platforms provide high ground advantage. Vulnerability to bludgeoning damage. They can't climb down quickly. Destroying ladders on platforms isolates them. Quivers contain 40 arrows worth taking.
aiRoomPrompt: A 120ft diameter circular room with 5ft grid. Four 10ft raised platforms with ladders. Low walls for cover in center. Arrow slits in platforms.

name: Goblin Warband
roomDescription: A mob of goblins fills this chamber, armed to the teeth and spoiling for a fight. They surge forward in a green wave, their war cries deafening in the enclosed space.
dmDescription: Overwhelming numbers but low individual HP. Minions go down easily, warriors are tougher. They lose morale if half are killed (DC 12 Intimidation forces retreat). War chest in back: 75 gp, goblin war banner (trophy or quest item).

winConditions.condition: Break their morale at half strength

aiRoomPrompt: A 140ft x 100ft goblin barracks with 5ft grid. Crude bunks and weapon racks. War table with crude map. Two exits.

name: Specter Tomb
roomDescription: Darkness pools unnaturally in the corners of this tomb. Skeletons stand guard while darker shapes drift through the shadows, their touch promising cold death.
dmDescription: Shadows drain Strength while skeletons distract. Focus on shadows first. Light magic is essential. The tomb belongs to an evil knight—destroying his corpse (in central sarcophagus) banishes the undead. Treasure: 50 gp, knight's signet ring (25 gp).
aiRoomPrompt: A 130ft x 100ft knight's tomb with 5ft grid. Central sarcophagus with effigy. Armor displays on walls. Unnaturally dark corners.

name: Dire Wolf Den
roomDescription: Bones crunch underfoot as you enter this den. Wolves snarl from the shadows, but it's the massive black-furred beast in the center that commands your attention—a worg, intelligent and malevolent.
dmDescription: The worg commands the wolves (understands Common/Goblin). It may parley if offered food (DC 14 Persuasion). If the worg dies, wolves flee. Den contains remains of previous victims: 35 gp, a damaged shield, a torn map.
aiRoomPrompt: A 110ft x 90ft natural cave den with 5ft grid. Bones and remains scattered. Central sleeping area. One main entrance, one small escape exit.

name: Modron Patrol
roomDescription: Geometric creatures of clockwork precision march in perfect formation. Their mechanical bodies click and whir as they scan the area with emotionless efficiency.
dmDescription: Modrons only attack if laws are broken in their presence or if you interfere with their mission. They're searching for 'Rogue Element 7' (a malfunctioning modron elsewhere). Helping them earns their neutrality. Cogs and gears worth 20 gp.
aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 100ft geometric chamber with 5ft grid. Perfect right angles everywhere. Mechanical aesthetic. Clean and orderly.

name: Jackalwere Ambush
roomDescription: Two travelers wave for help at the edge of the chamber, claiming to be lost. Something about their smiles seems... wrong. Their forms blur as they reveal jackals standing on hind legs.
dmDescription: Jackalweres use Sleep Gaze (DC 10 Wis or fall asleep). They're resistant to nonmagical weapons. They posed as travelers to lure victims. Their 'belongings' are stolen: 40 gp, traveler's outfit, fake identification.

winConditions.condition: Resist Sleep Gaze and attack with magic/silver

aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 80ft crossroads chamber with 5ft grid. Multiple exits. Fake campsite setup. Dim torchlight.

name: Satyr Tricksters
roomDescription: Melodious music echoes through this overgrown grotto. Two goat-legged figures lounge on rocks, playing pipes and drinking wine. They eye you with amused curiosity rather than hostility.
dmDescription: Satyrs aren't inherently hostile but enjoy pranks. They demand entertainment or tribute (DC 15 Performance or 25 gp wine) to pass. If insulted, they attack with magic. They know dungeon secrets and will share if entertained.
aiRoomPrompt: A 120ft x 100ft underground grotto with 5ft grid. Overgrown with vines and moss. Natural spring. Fey aesthetic.

name: Giant Frog Pond
roomDescription: A murky pool fills most of this chamber. As you approach, massive frogs surface, their bulbous eyes fixed on you. With disturbing speed, they launch themselves at you, tongues extended.
dmDescription: Frogs can Swallow Small creatures (DC 11 Str to escape from inside). Water is 5ft deep (difficult terrain). Staying on dry land limits their approach. Frog legs are a delicacy: 5 gp per frog to right buyer.

winConditions.condition: Stay on dry land and fight defensively

aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 100ft flooded chamber with 5ft grid. Large central pool (5ft deep water). Narrow dry ledges around edges. Lily pads.

name: Crocodile Lair
roomDescription: What looks like logs floating in the water suddenly move. Armored reptiles glide toward you, their powerful jaws snapping as they surge from the shallows.
dmDescription: Crocodiles grapple (DC 12 escape) and drag victims underwater (drowning rules apply). They have advantage on creatures in water. Fighting on land gives the party the advantage. Previous victim's gear in shallows: 30 gp, waterlogged pack.
aiRoomPrompt: A 120ft x 80ft flooded tunnel with 5ft grid. Central water channel (10ft deep). Raised walkways on sides. Submerged logs.

name: Animated Broom Closet
roomDescription: You open a closet door and brooms fly out, sweeping at you with aggressive intent. The enchanted cleaning implements seem determined to sweep YOU out.
dmDescription: Animated brooms are fragile (HP 10) comic relief. They're programmed to sweep intruders away and won't pursue beyond the room. The closet contains cleaning supplies worth 10 gp and a Ring of Water Walking hidden in a bucket.

winConditions.condition: Simply close the door and leave

aiRoomPrompt: A 60ft x 40ft storage closet with 5ft grid. Shelves with cleaning supplies. Mops and buckets. Cramped space.

name: Dust Mephit Ruins
roomDescription: Ancient ruins lie thick with dust. Clouds of particles swirl unnaturally, coalescing into small humanoid forms with dry, rasping voices that cough mockingly at your presence.
dmDescription: Dust mephits use Blinding Breath (DC 10 Dex or blinded 1 min). Death Burst creates 5ft dust cloud (same effect). Water suppresses their abilities. Ancient treasures buried in dust: 45 gp, a corroded bronze crown (30 gp restored).
aiRoomPrompt: A 120ft x 100ft ancient ruin with 5ft grid. Dust-covered everywhere. Broken pillars and walls. Collapsed ceiling section.

name: Gas Spore Quarantine
roomDescription: Two beholders float motionless ahead, their eye stalks drooping oddly. Something seems wrong—they're not attacking. Then you notice the fungal texture of their 'skin' and realize these are something far stranger.
dmDescription: Gas spores look like beholders (DC 15 Nature to identify). When they die, they explode (DC 15 Con or 3d6 poison + infected). Infection: without treatment, creature dies in 1d12+Con hours and sprouts 2d4 new gas spores. Treasure in corner from panicked victim: 40 gp.
aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 80ft quarantine chamber with 5ft grid. Warning signs in Undercommon. Sealed doors. Dead adventurer's remains in corner.

name: Scout Patrol
roomDescription: Two figures in leather armor freeze mid-conversation, hands going to weapons. They wear no insignia but their coordinated movement speaks of professional training.
dmDescription: Scouts are working for a rival faction. They'll negotiate if outmatched (DC 13 Intimidation). They have reconnaissance notes about the dungeon that could be valuable. Equipment: shortbows, shortswords, 25 gp each.
aiRoomPrompt: A 90ft x 70ft waystation with 5ft grid. Makeshift camp. Surveillance equipment. Multiple exits for escape.

name: Tough Gang
roomDescription: Two burly thugs crack their knuckles as you enter their territory. Scars and crude tattoos mark their exposed arms. 'Wrong turn, friends,' one growls.
dmDescription: Toughs are enforcers for a local gang. They'll take a bribe (50 gp) to let you pass and share information. They fight dirty and try to grapple casters. Loot on bodies: 20 gp each, gang tokens (could be useful later).
aiRoomPrompt: A 80ft x 60ft gang territory with 5ft grid. Crude furniture. Graffiti on walls. Makeshift weapons. One main entrance.

name: Performer Troupe
roomDescription: Music and laughter echo ahead. Two colorfully dressed performers bow dramatically as you enter, but their smiles don't reach their eyes. Something about this 'performance' feels like a trap.
dmDescription: These performers are actually thieves using entertainment as a distraction. One performs while the other attempts to pick pockets (DC 14 Perception to notice). If caught, they fight. They have: 55 gp (some stolen), fake gems, and real lock picks.

winConditions.reward: No XP, lose 2d6 gp to pickpocket

aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 80ft underground tavern with 5ft grid. Small stage area. Tables and chairs. Atmospheric lighting.

name: Myconid Colony
roomDescription: Towering mushroom-people stand in silent communion, spores drifting between them in visible clouds. They turn toward you slowly, releasing puffs of spores that carry meaning you almost understand.
dmDescription: Myconids aren't inherently hostile. They communicate via Rapport Spores (willing targets can telepathically communicate). They seek help against 'the rotting ones' (zombies in another room). Helping them earns safe passage and healing spores.
aiRoomPrompt: A 120ft x 100ft fungal garden with 5ft grid. Various mushrooms from small to huge. Spore-filled air. Bioluminescent lighting.

name: Black Bear Den
roomDescription: A mother bear rises from her nest, cubs tumbling behind her. She roars a warning, her mate emerging from the shadows. They're just protecting their home, but they won't let you pass.
dmDescription: Bears are territorial but not evil. DC 15 Animal Handling calms them if no hostile actions taken. They have Multiattack. If one dies, the other becomes Reckless. Honey in their den: 10 gp worth (if brave enough to take it).
aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 80ft natural cave den with 5ft grid. Nest materials. Honeycomb in corner. Bear cubs (non-combatants). Two exits.

name: Bone Heap
roomDescription: Bones are piled high in this ossuary—femurs, ribs, and skulls stacked with disturbing care. As you watch, the pile begins to shift. Skeletons assemble themselves while severed hands skitter free.
dmDescription: The undead animate when the room is entered or when bones are disturbed. Turn Undead is very effective here. A necromancer's journal buried in the bones explains the curse (DC 14 Investigation to find). Breaking the carved skull on the wall (AC 10, 15 HP) ends the animation.
aiRoomPrompt: A 100ft x 100ft ossuary with 5ft grid. Bone piles throughout. Carved skull on wall. Dim candlelight. Macabre decorations.
